modules.description: This module manages event channels and ports for inter-domain communication in a Xen environment. It supports operations to create, connect, send, and receive events over channels, with blocking and asynchronous capabilities. Use cases include coordinating domain wakeups, handling event notifications, and managing channel lifecycle across domain boundaries.

This module implements communication channels between Xen domains using the Vchan protocol. It provides functions to establish server and client connections, read and write data buffers, and manage connection lifecycle with shutdown and close operations. The module works with Xen-specific data types such as domain IDs, port identifiers, and Cstruct buffers, and handles errors related to reading, writing, and connection state. Use cases include inter-domain communication in virtualized environments, such as passing network traffic or coordinating state between guest domains and a control domain.

This module manages memory sharing and mapping operations for Xen guests. It provides functions to convert between integer and grant types, share and unshare memory regions with specific domains, and map or unmap memory for direct access. It works with data types representing memory grants, shared memory regions, and mapped memory buffers, enabling direct communication between virtual machines.
